newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian shares end higher, cement stock jumps.
newsitem.headline: Colombian shares end higher, cement stock jumps.

text.p: Colombian shares ended mostly higher in trading that saw gainers led by a top cement company and Banco Ganadero, the country's leading bank in terms of assets.

Medellin's IBOMED general price index rose 1.15 percent to close at 18,374.48 in trading that saw volume totaling 2.7 billion pesos. Bogota's IBB added 1.22 percent, ending at 1,217.94 on active trading of 3.2 billion pesos.
"There's a lot of liquidity and investors with fixed income papers coming due are turning to stocks as they look for more profit," one Bogota-based broker said.

The day's biggest winner by far was Cementos del Caribe of the powerful Sindicato Antioqueno conglomerate. Dealers said foreign fund buying pushed it up 5.4 percent in Bogota, where it ended at 6,381 pesos per share.
Local investors were mostly responsible for the rise in Ganadero's blue-chip shares, meanwhile. The bank gained an impressive 4.7 percent to close at 398 pesos per share in Bogota.
Brewer Bavaria, flagship of the Julio Mario Santo Domingo business group, ended up 1.64 percent in the capital at 8,260 pesos per share but it slipped 0.66 percent in Medellin.
